  • *Scientist III/IV- Decatur, IL**
  • *ADM Research**
  • *This is a full time, exempt position**
ADM Cell Engineering team is seeking a highly motivated scientist with a strong background in synthetic biology. The successful candidate will design and execute high-throughput microbial strain engineering workflows in support of strain development efforts at ADM Research. In this role, the candidate will be responsible for ideation, design, and execution of the strain builds to generate diversity, and performance analysis steps with the Automation team, including consolidation of data and generation of recommendations for the next round of strain development. The candidate will contribute to continuous improvement of workflows and protocols, and the further development of capabilities for the team. Job responsibilities will include: a) supporting the Design-Build-Test-Learn cycle of microbial strain development for a range of microbial products of commercial interest to ADM, in addition to HTP screening of strain libraries from conventional mutagenesis when necessary; b) developing technical expertise and adding to the knowledge base of the team in the area of Synthetic Biology; c) investigating and developing new technologies that can be incorporated into strain development workflows, and keeping up-to-date with advances in the industry. The successful candidate will have demonstrated ability to work under minimal direction, be able to develop experimental strategies and interact with other scientists to support projects in strain development, metabolic engineering and fermentation.

Requirements:

+ Ph.D. degree or equivalent and relevant experience in synthetic biology, molecular microbiology, or related field.

+ 5+ years of experience in molecular genetic techniques, ideally with experience in automation of DNA assembly, transformation, HTP culturing and assays.

+ Established competencies in the use of bioinformatics software tools for design of DNA constructs, and in the statistical analysis of data.

+ Preferred candidate will have industrial biotechnology experience, demonstrating delivery of value to the business through execution of projects.

+ Excellent written and oral communication skills with both technical and non-technical personnel

+ Demonstrated ability to work with diverse, multidisciplinary teams to coordinate the transfer of bench scale knowledge through scale-up to provide value for the business.
